channel.title: nlin.SI updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: nlin.SI updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Many-body density of states of bosonic and fermionic gases: a combinatorial approach
item.description: arXiv:2409.08696v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We use a combinatorial approach to obtain exact expressions for the many-body density of states of fermionic and bosonic gases with equally spaced single-particle spectra. We identify a mapping that reveals a remarkable property, namely, fermionic and bosonic gases have the same many-body density of states, up to a shift corresponding to ground state energy. Additionally, we show that there is a regime, comprising the validity range of the Bethe approximation, where the many-body density of states becomes independent of the number of particles.
item.dc:creator: Carolyn Echter, Georg Maier, Juan-Diego Urbina, Caio Lewenkopf, Klaus Richter

item.title: Killing tensors on reducible spaces
item.description: arXiv:2401.07620v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We prove that on the product of two Riemannian manifolds one of which is compact, any Killing tensor is reducible, that is, is the sum of products of Killing tensors on the factors. The same is true for the lifts to the universal cover of Killing tensors on a compact manifold with reducible holonomy. We give a local description of Killing tensors on product manifolds and present an example of a complete product manifold whose factors are locally irreducible which admits an irreducible Killing tensor field.
item.dc:creator: Vladimir S. Matveev, Yuri Nikolayevsky

item.title: Auxiliary Field Deformations of (Semi-)Symmetric Space Sigma Models
item.description: arXiv:2409.05704v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We generalize the auxiliary field deformations of the principal chiral model (PCM) introduced in arXiv:2405.05899 and arXiv:2407.16338 to sigma models whose target manifolds are symmetric or semi-symmetric spaces, including a Wess-Zumino term in the latter case. This gives rise to a new infinite family of classically integrable $\mathbb{Z}_2$ and $\mathbb{Z}_4$ coset models of the form which are of interest in applications of integrability to worldsheet string theory and holography. We demonstrate that every theory in this infinite class admits a zero-curvature representation for its equations of motion by exhibiting a Lax connection.
item.dc:creator: Daniele Bielli, Christian Ferko, Liam Smith, Gabriele Tartaglino-Mazzucchelli
